name: Maximum Sine
description:
You have given integers 
    a
, 
    b
, 
    p
, and 
    q
. Let 
    f(x) =
    
    abs(
    sin(
    p/q
    π x))
. Find minimum possible
integer 
    x
 that maximizes 
    f(x)
 where 
    a 
    ≤ x 
    ≤ b
. Input
Each test contains multiple test cases. The first line contains the number of
test cases 
    t
 (
    1 
    ≤ t 
    ≤ 100
) — the number of test cases. The
first line of each test case contains four integers 
    a
, 
    b
, 
    p
,
and 
    q
 (
    0 
    ≤ a 
    ≤ b 
    ≤ 10^9
, 
    1 
    ≤ p
, 
    q 
    ≤
    10^9
). Output Print the minimum possible integer 
    x
 for each test
cases, separated by newline. Example Input 2 0 3 1 3 17 86 389 995 Output 1 55
Note In the first test case, 
    f(0) = 0
, 
    f(1) = f(2) 
    ≈
    0.866
, 
    f(3) = 0
. In the second test case, 
    f(55) 
    ≈
    0.999969
, which is the largest among all possible values.
